content:
• Monday, November 27, 2017
  • ASC

    Ardmore Shipping announces 5.58M-share secondary offering

    • Ardmore Shipping (NYSE:ASC) -9.6% after-hours on news that it filed for a secondary public offering of ~5.58M shares to be sold by GA Holdings, which also intends to grant the underwriters an option to purchase up to an additional ~634K shares.
    • ASC will purchase from the underwriter 1.35M common shares and purchase from the selling shareholder an additional ~85K shares.
    • ASC will not receive any proceeds from the offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM
  • EKSO

    Ekso Bionics -2.9% as exec clears 50,000 shares

    • Ekso Bionics (NASDAQ:EKSO) is off 2.9% in postmarket trading after an SEC form shows Russ Angold -- president of EksoWorks -- disposed of 50,000 shares.
    • The sale happened last Wednesday just before the Thanksgiving holiday. Angold sold the shares for $3.51 each, for gross proceeds of $175,500.
    • Shares are down 22.8% in 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM | 23 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: APEN +26.5%. THO +10.4%. SRRA +9.4%. WGO +5.1%. TECD +4.6%.
    • Top losers: ASC -9.1%. USAT -5.6%. DCIX -5.3%. UNH -1.6%. XIN -1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • OTIC

    Otonomy drops support for Otiprio to sharpen focus on pipeline development; shares up 3% after hours

    • Otonomy (NASDAQ:OTIC) is up 3% after hours on light volume on the heels of its announcement that it has terminated commercial support of OTIPRIO (ciprofloxacin otic suspension) so it can focus its resources on developing its pipeline, especially OTIVIDEX for Ménière’s disease.
    • The company the action should save ~$20M next year. Discussions are apparently underway to divest OTIPRIO.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris' European marketing application for Macrilen for AGHD accepted for review; shares up 16% after hours

    • The European Medicines Agency accepts for review Aeterna Zentaris' (NASDAQ:AEZS) marketing application seeking approval for Macrilen (macimorelin) for the evaluation of adult growth hormone deficiency (AGHD).
    • The official start of the review period was November 23 so the EMA's action date, assuming the standard 210-day review period, is June 21, 2018.
    • Shares are up 16% after hours on average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • GVP

    GSE Systems announces sim platform implementation by major client

    • GSE Systems (NYSEMKT:GVP) announces an unnamed existing client is implementing the OpenSim simulation platform across all of the client’s nuclear plant sites in the southern U.S.
    • No financial terms were disclosed.
    • GSE shares are up 3% aftermarket.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • ZEN

    Zendesk appoints Workday exec to board

    • Zendesk (NYSE:ZEN) appoints Mike Frandsen, Workday’s executive director of products, to its board. 
    • Frandsen’s work history also includes stints at the Intel-acquired DemandTec and Oracle-acquired PeopleSoft. 
    • Zendesk shares are up 2.9% aftermarket.  
    • Previously: Zendesk beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (Nov. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • MEDP

    Medpace readies 4M-share stock offering from current investor; shares down 2% after hours

    • Medpace Holdings (NASDAQ:MEDP) slips 2% after hours on light volume in response to its planned secondary offering of 4M common shares held by affiliates of institutional investor Cinven Capital Management (V) General Partner Limited.
    • The company will receive no proceeds from the sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • UNH

    UnitedHealth sees 2018 non-GAAP EPS growth of 5.5 - 8.5%; shares down 1% after hours

    • UnitedHealth Group (NYSE:UNH) updates guidance ahead of tomorrow's Investor Conference in New York.
    • 2017: Revenues: at least $200B; EPS: ~$9.45; non-GAAP EPS: ~$10.00.
    • 2018: Revenues: $223B - 225B; EPS: $10.00 - 10.30; non-GAAP EPS: $10.55 - 10.85; CF Ops: $13.3B - 13.8B.
    • 2018 consensus: Non-GAAP EPS of $10.83 on revenues of $218B.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • TECD

    Tech Data beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Tech Data (NASDAQ:TECD): Q3 EPS of $2.00 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $9.14B (+40.8% Y/Y) beats by $30M.
    • Shares +2.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • PETX

    Aratana launches $35M stock offering; shares off 5% after hours

    • Thinly traded micro cap Aratana Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PETX) slips 5% after hours in response to its planned $35M public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 18 Comments
  • MTSC

    MTS Systems -5.7% after Q4 beats, mixed guidance

    • MTS Systems (NASDAQ:MTSC) shares drop 5.7% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates.
    • Mixed FY18 guidance has revenue from $780M to $820M (consensus: $810.55M) and EPS from $2.05 to $2.30 (consensus: $2.51). 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: MTS Systems beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • DOVA

    FDA accepts Dova Pharma's marketing application for avatrombopag for thrombocytopenia, action date May 21, 2018; shares ahead 1% after hours

    • Thinly traded Dova Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DOVA) perks up 1% after hours on the heels of its announcement that the FDA has accepted for review its marketing application seeking approval for avatrombopag for the treatment of thrombocytopenia in patients with chronic liver disease about to undergo a procedure.
    • Under Priority Review status, the agency's action date is May 21, 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • THO

    Thor beats by $0.59, beats on revenue

    • Thor (NYSE:THO): Q1 EPS of $2.43 beats by $0.59.
    • Revenue of $2.23B (+30.4% Y/Y) beats by $240M.
    • Shares +4.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 11 Comments
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharma launches 11M-share stock offering; shares down 4% after hours

    • Catalyst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CPRX) readies a public offering of 11M common shares. Price and terms have yet to be released.
    • Shares are off 4% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 9 Comments
  • MRVL

    Cowen raises its Marvell Tech price target

    • Cowen raises its Marvell Tech (NASDAQ:MRVL) price target from $21 to $29.
    • Firm says color around Cavium deal is all that matters going into the October quarter earnings. 
    • Cowen thinks the Street is undervaluing the company’s potential for CY18. 
    • Firm sees organic EPS of $1.60 and CY19 EPS near $2. 
    • Marvell shares closed today down 1.76%.    
    • Previously: Bloomberg: Starboard to vote for Marvell-Cavium deal (Nov. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • AMSWA

    American Software subsidiary acquires analytics company

    • American Software (NASDAQ:AMSWA) subsidiary Logility acquires Halo Business Intelligence, a supplier of advanced analytics and business intelligence solutions for the supply chain.
    • The acquisition expands Logility’s advanced analytics through AI and machine learning. 
    • No financial terms disclosed.   
    • American Software shares are up 1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • TMUS

    Moffett: Sprint/T-Mobile breakup good for sector (except Sprint)

    • T-Mobile (TMUS +0.8%) earned an upgrade to Buy from MoffettNathanson, which says the breakup of merger talks with Sprint (S +0.2%) will ultimately benefit the upstart No. 3 carrier.
    • The collapse of the deal "will ultimately prove to be good news for the sector," writes Craig Moffett, though with one clear loser: “Robbed of the prospect of a merger — at least for now — Sprint will now have to focus on sustainability. That means less, not more, promotionality."
    • And that means fewer net subscriber additions, which will be absorbed by Sprint's rivals, he adds.
    • Moffett has raised his price target on TMUS to $73 from $69, while trimming his price target on Sprint to $2 from $6. (Sprint's currently at $6.16.)
    • He's reiterated a Buy on Verizon (VZ +1.6%; $51 price target) and a Neutral on AT&T (T -0.2%), based on wireline troubles, debt and declining revenues at DirecTV.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 77 Comments
  • VMW

    BofAML raises its VMware price target

    • Bank of America Merrill Lynch raises its VMware (NYSE:VMW) price target from $125 to $148.
    • The raise came ahead of the Amazon Web Services re:Invent conference, which kicked off today and runs through Friday.  
    • VMware shares are up 1.6%.      
    • Previously: The Information: VMware circling security acquisitions (Nov. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 3 Comments
  • CUDA

    Barracuda downgraded as analysts see topping bids unlikely

    • Shares in Barracuda Networks (CUDA +16.5%), up large today on word of a go-private bid from Thoma Bravo, have settled in at close to the offer price as analysts downgrade, discounting the prospect of a competing bid.
    • Piper Jaffray, Stifel Nicolaus, Rosenblatt and BTIG have dropped ratings from Buy to Neutral, with the prospect of a topping offer (as Piper Jaffray says) unlikely.
    • Meanwhile, KeyBanc thinks the M&A activity on a deeply discounted firm is a positive for similarly discounted peers Fortinet (FTNT -0.2%) and Rapid7 (RPD +0.5%), though those shares aren't making similar moves today. Consolidation in the sector is likely to continue manifesting via go-private deals, the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • DECK

    Marcato Capital responds to Deckers board plan

    • Marcato Capital is barking at Deckers Outdoor (DECK -1.7%) again as it asks shareholders to vote for its own nominees to the board.
    • "Deckers' announced intention to add new directors is a desperate attempt to avoid accountability for failing to achieve its strategic goals over a period of multiple years," reads a missive from the hedge fund.
    • "Deckers' stockholders deserve the right to select directors for themselves, and should not leave this important decision to a Board that has failed them time and time again," adds Marcato.
    • Marcato holds about an 8.4% stake in Deckers through funds it manages.
    • Shares of Deckers are up 14% over the last 52 weeks to trail the 18% return on the S&P 500 Index.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • SSYS

    Stratasys announces agreement with Philips

    • Stratasys (NASDAQ:SSYS) signs an agreement with Philips for 3D printing in medical modeling.
    • The agreement combines Stratasys’ Direct Manufacturing parts-on-demand service with Philips’ IntelliSpace Portal 10 for streamlined interfacing and dedicated workflows. 
    • No financial terms disclosed. 
    • Stratasys shares are up 0.84%.       
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:55 pm

    • Gainers: TCCO +27%. UTSI +22%. CUDA +17%. MTBC +15%. BV-OLD +14%.
    • Losers: ELTK -25%. ASYS -19%. SQ -14%. NETE -12%. AVID -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 21 Comments
  • SEDG

    SolarEdge -3% as Deutsche Bank downgrades to Hold from Buy

    • SolarEdge Technologies (SEDG -2.9%) sinks after Deutsche Bank downgrades shares to Hold from Buy, believing shares are fully discounting prospects of strong execution in solar and non-solar segments.
    • The firm also thinks 2018 industry volumes could disappoint to the downside and noise around increased competition from Huawei likely will increase over the next few quarters.
    • Deutsche Bank sees no further positive margin tailwind from stronger international sales, and it expects pricing pressure to intensify as component shortages ease and as Huawei and Enphase become more aggressive on the pricing front.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • EHIC

    eHi Car Services announces receipt of preliminary non-binding proposal to acquire the Company

    • eHi Car Services (EHIC +3%) announced that its Board has received a preliminary non-binding proposal letter dated Nov. 26, 2017, from Goliath Advisors, third party China-based investment fund.
    • Goliath has proposed to acquire all outstanding common shares of the Company for $13.35 in cash per American depositary share of the Company (each representing two Class A common shares) or US$6.675 in cash per common share of the Company.
    • The Board ‎plans to evaluate the Proposal Letter. The Board cautions the Company's shareholders and others considering trading in its securities that the Board just received the Proposal Letter and no decisions have been made with respect to the Company's response to the Proposal Letter and the transaction contemplated thereby.
    • The Company does not undertake any obligation to provide any updates with respect to this or any other transaction, except as required under applicable law.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • MU

    Stifel defends Micron and NAND after Morgan Stanley comments

    • Stifel defends Micron (NASDAQ:MU) after this morning’s Morgan Stanley comments.
    • Morgan Stanley increased Micron’s price target from $39 to $55 and maintained its Overweight rating. 
    • The analyst said he recommended Micron more than other chip stocks, as he’s more bullish on DRAM. 
    • Morgan Stanley was less optimistic about NAND pricing.
    • Stifel counters with a forecast that NAND pricing will fall in-line or better than the firm’s estimates.   
    • Micron shares are down 3.4%. 
    • Previously: Morgan Stanley cuts view on Samsung Electronics (Nov. 27)
    • Previously: Morgan Stanley downgrades TSMC, chipmakers fall (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 82 Comments
  • ENB

    Enbridge wins deal with Michigan on Line 5 pipeline

    • Enbridge (ENB -2.3%) says it has reached a deal with Michigan authorities on the aging Line 5 pipelines that run along the bottom of the Straits of Mackinac between Lake Huron and Lake Michigan.
    • ENB says the agreement includes completing an evaluation by next June on three potential options to eventually replace the 7-km stretch of underwater pipeline and immediate safety measures to reduce the risk of a leak.
    • The twin pipelines were laid in 1953 and have raised concerns about the potential impact on the Great Lakes if the 540K bbl/day pipeline were to leak; Line 5 operates currently at less than 25% of maximum pressure capacity for enhanced safety.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 18 Comments
  • ZN

    Zion Oil +13% after winning extension on Megiddo-Jezreel license

    • Zion Oil & Gas (ZN +13.1%) shoots higher after receiving a two-year extension from Israeli regulators on its Megiddo-Jezreel License No. 401, extending its validity to December 2019.
    • "This multi-year extension should assure investors that our current well will continue unabated, without the risk that the Energy Ministry would pull our license," ZN says.
    • ZN President Dustin Guinn says the company is preparing to resume drilling operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 10 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: NOG +19%. ZN +12%. METC +7%. PZG +7%. VHI +%.
    • Losers: USAU -9%. WMLP-OLD -9%. UEC -7%. CRZO -7%. EPE -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • JCI

    Insider buying at Johnson Controls

    • Johnson Control International (JCI +0.3%) is back in positive territory for the day after the company reports that CEO George Oliver picked up shares.
    • Oliver disclosed buying 27.3K shares at an average of $36.80. The exec now holds just under 635K shares.
    • SEC Form 4
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 15 Comments
  • JMEI

    Buyers group pulls Jumei offer

    • Jumei International Holding (JMEI +11.6%) announced that a special board committee received a letter from a buyers group led by Sequoia Capital on the withdrawal of its non-binding going private proposal at $7 per ADS.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM

  • Mexico lower as Morgan Stanley goes underweight; finmin resigns

    • Ahead of what's expected to be a run at the presidency, Mexican Finance Minister José Antonio Meade has resigned his position. He's seen as possibly being named the presidential candidate of the ruling Institutional Revolutionary Party in February.
    • Citing political uncertainly ahead of the 2018 elections (though not having to do with Meade's resignation, which was expected), Morgan Stanley trims its outlook on Mexican shares to Underweight from Neutral.
    • The iShares MSCI Mexico Index (NYSEARCA:EWW) is off its worst levels, but down 0.5% on the session.
    • ETFs: EWW, MXF, MXE, DBMX, HEWW, MEXX
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: GROW +19%. OPHC +18%.QD +16%. XIN +10%. FAC +%.
    • Losers: YIN -9%. GCAP -7%. FANH -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • CRZO

    Carrizo Oil & Gas sells DJ Basin assets for $140M

    • Carrizo Oil & Gas (CRZO -7.2%) agrees to sell its assets in the DJ Basin to an unnamed buyer for $140M plus up to $15M contingent payments based on crude oil prices exceeding certain thresholds over the next three years.
    • CRZO says net production from the assets totaled 2,427 boe/day (69% oil, 84% liquids) during Q3.
    • CRZO also says it closed on a pair of previously announced divestitures in the Appalachia region, selling all of its in the Utica and Marcellus shale formations for a combined $146M.
    • Stifel analysts raise their stock price target for CRZO to $42 following the sale, but shares are sharply lower as U.S. crude oil falls ~1.4% to $58.13/bbl.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 9 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: CERC +45%. MARA +29%. MGCD +24%. SGRP +21%. NOG +20%. GROW +19%. OPHC +18%. UTSI +17%. CUDA +16%. QD +16%.
    • Losers: RIOT -29%. ELTK -25%. SRAX -18%. OCUL -17%. NDRA -14%. MICT -14%. QDEL -14%. ASYS -12%. ACST -13%. AVID -12%.
      •  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 17 Comments
  • OCUL

    Ocular continues CRL-stoked slide, down 17%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Ocular Therapeutix (OCUL -16.6%) is down on a 5x surge in volume. Shares have lost almost 70% of their value since the company received a second CRL from the FDA related to its marketing application for Dextenza.
    • Previously: Ocular Therapeutix -30% as FDA denies NDA for Dextenza (July 11)
    • Previously: FDA rejects Ocular's Dextenza NDA for ocular pain; shares off 4% premarket (July 25, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 21 Comments
  • GBTC

    More join the crypto club

    • Forget politics. It sounds like Bitcoin was the big topic of discussion at Thanksgiving family gatherings. Judging by the action in the price of cryptos and in new accounts at exchanges like Coinbase, returning college students and millennials convinced grandparents, parents, aunts and uncles to jump in with both feet.
    • It was earlier reported that Coinbase added 100K accounts between Wednesday and Friday; that's gone up to 300K (to 13.3M total) as of yesterday.
    • As for the price, Bitcoin has pared some of its massive gains since challenging $10K on Sunday, now trading hands at $9,557. Ether and Litecoin also posted huge advances over the weekend.
    • Meanwhile, hedge fund giant Ken Griffin adds his name to the list of those comparing Bitcoin and tulip bulbs.
    • Checking related stocks, while Bitcoin Investment Trust (OTCQX:GBTC +17.5%) is surging alongside its underlying asset, names like Riot Blockchain (RIOT -31%) and Xuniei (XNET -7.5%) are giving back some of their recent massive gains.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 95 Comments
  • SWIR

    Sierra Wireless +9.4% as Raymond James moves to Outperform

    • Sierra Wireless (NASDAQ:SWIR) has gained 9.4% today after Raymond James gave it an upgrade to Outperform, from Market Perform.
    • That's a move away from the bulk of analysts, more than a half-dozen of which have Hold-equivalent ratings.
    • Shares are up 32.2% in 2017, but are still about 29% below a 52-week high hit this past summer.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 16 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: SORL +9%. WILC +7%. ONP +6%. NVFY +6%. OTIV +5%.
    • Losers: RCKY -8%. KBSF -8%. ZX -7%. LTEA -6%. LBIX-OLD -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • PLAY

    Sharp drop for Dave & Buster's after Canaccord lowers estimates

    • Dave & Buster's (PLAY -5.4%) falls sharply after Canaccord Genuity lowers estimates on the retail chain.
    • The firm now expects D&B to report Q3 comparabale sales growth of -3% vs. -1% prior forecast. The hurricanes that hit the U.S. during the quarter are seen as a bigger impact than lower NFL ratings.
    • The Canaccord estimate for restaurant operating margin is dropped 110 bps to 24.1% of sales due to the sales weakness and higher labor costs.
    • Dave & Buster's is due to report earnings after the market closes on December 5.
    • Sources: CNBC and Nasdaq.com
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 6 Comments
  • MDP

    Meredith, Time jump after deal; Time chief Battista to exit

    • Meredith (NYSE:MDP) is up 8.2% and Time (TIME) up 9.2% after the two came to a a deal to sell the iconic Time to its publishing rival, with more details emerging this morning.
    • Meredith says the billionaire Koch brothers -- who helped enable the $1.85B bid with $650M in financing from Koch Equity Development -- "will have no influence on Meredith's editorial or managerial operations" and won't have a seat on Meredith's board.
    • When the Kochs were first connected to a possible deal, speculation mounted over whether the two would try to promote conservative politics through the brands.
    • Time CEO/President Rich Battista, brought in just over a year ago, will exit after helping with the transition.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • BKYI

    BIO-key announces government project

    • BIO-key International (NASDAQ:BKYI) announces a project with the Province of British Columbia to use the company’s fingerprint authentication solution.
    • The province will use the WEB-key solution for positive biometric ID. 
    • Financial terms not disclosed.  
    • BIO-key shares are up 4.6%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • CIEN

    Ciena +1.6% as BofAML boosts to Buy

    • Ciena (NASDAQ:CIEN) is up 1.6% on one of its best days in months, with BofA Merrill Lynch upgrading to Buy from Neutral.
    • Valuation looks attractive, the firm says, and the company is set to rebound from what it thinks is a temporary issue with spending timing. Ciena's made gains in new verticals that put it into good position, with the current demand softness already reflected in the share price.
    • The firm has a price target of $28, implying 31.5% upside from today's higher price.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • NEPT

    Neptune up 10% on plan for omega-3-containing cannabis products

    • Thinly traded micro cap Neptune Technologies & Bioressources (NEPT +9.6%) is up on almost a 6x surge in volume in response to its announcement that it has inked an exclusive global license agreement to use the MaxSimil technology in cannabis-derived products.
    • The contract allows it to research, manufacture and sell cannabis and/or cannabinoid-rich hemp-derived products that contain monoglyceride omega-3-rich ingredients.
    • MaxSimil is an omega-3 fatty acid delivery technology.
    • The company has submitted a request to Health Canada to produce cannabis oil under the Access to Cannabis for Medical Purposes Regulations.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 3 Comments
  • INTU

    Intuit selects AWS for machine learning and AI platform

    • Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) selects Amazon Web Services (NASDAQ:AMZN) as its machine learning and AI platform.
    • Intuit will integrate the AWS Lex technology into QuickBooks Assistant and other products. 
    • The Lex service builds conversational interfaces into any app using voice and text.
    • Intuit shares are up 0.5%.  
    • Amazon shares are up 1%.  
    • Previously: Amazon announces VR developer tools, video provider services (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • AUDC

    AudioCodes extends share repurchase program

    • AudioCodes (NASDAQ:AUDC) receives court approval to repurchase up to $20M additional ordinary shares through May 27.  
    • The funding will come from working capital.
    • AudioCodes shares are up 5.2%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • QDEL

    Quidel down 14% on Beckman move to sell BNP assay directly

    • Quidel (QDEL -14.4%) slumps on double normal volume as investors head for the exits after Beckman Coulter announced that it will seek court action to allow it to directly sale a natriuretic peptide assay that is currently exclusively marketed by Quidel pursuant to an agreement with Alere.
    • Beckman wants to offer the test for its Access Family of Immunoassay Systems.
    • Update: In a statement, Quidel says it is "confident" in the legal strength and validity of its supply agreement with Beckman Coulter and plans to "vigorously defend" its rights under the agreement.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • SKX

    Skechers pops after strong Black Friday showing

    • Skechers (NYSE:SKX) is up 3.88% on solid volume after several investment firms call out strong traffic trends for the retail brand on Black Friday.
    • SunTrust's Pamela Quintiliano had Skechers listed as one of her retail winners for Black Friday.
    • Shares of Skechers hit a 52-week high of $34.94 earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 6 Comments
  • AHPI

    Allied Healthcare Products up 22%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Allied Healthcare Products (AHPI +22.2%) is up more than a 30x surge in volume in early trading.  Shares have jumped 42% in two trading days but news is scarce.
    • The company makes medical gas construction equipment, respiratory therapy gear, home healthcare products and emergency medical supplies.
    • Last quarter's sales were $7.9M (-6.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • CEA

    Select global airline stocks fall back

    • There's some skittish trading on some global airline stocks today.
    • China Eastern Airlines (CEA -4.4%) and China Southern Airlines (ZNH -6.1%) are both sharply lower to start the week.
    • Other global airline stocks trading down on the day are Cathay Pacific ADRs (OTCPK:CPCAY) -2.3%, LATAM Airlines LATAM LTM -1%, Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) -1.4% and Copa Holdings (NYSE:CPA) -1.2%.
    • U.S. carriers are faring better. The U.S. Global Jets ETF (NYSEARCA:JETS) is up 0.07% to stay above the $30 mark.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 1 Comment

  • Healthcare Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: AHPI +26%. MGCD +24%. CERC +21%. FCSC +16%. NEPT +9%.
    • Losers: RIOT -22%. QDEL -14%. GNCA -9%. OCUL -9%. ACST -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • CRBP

    Corbus Pharma awarded new U.S. patent covering lead candidate anabasum; shares up 2%

    • The USPTO issues U.S. Patent No. 9,820,964 to Corbus Pharmaceuticals (CRBP +2.1%) covering the use of pharmaceutical compositions comprising anabasum for the treatment of multiple fibrotic diseases, including systemic sclerosis, dermatomyositis and cystic fibrosis. The patent is in effect through 2034.
    • Anabasum is an oral synthetic endocannabinoid-mimetic that preferentially binds to the cannabinoid receptor type 2 (CB2) expressed on activated immune cells and fibroblasts. Activating CB2 triggers biochemical pathways that halt fibrosis and inflammation.

  • BSM

    Black Stone buys mineral, royalty interests from Noble Energy for $340M

    • Black Stone Minerals (BSM +2.9%) agrees to acquire a package of mineral and royalty assets from Noble Energy (NBL -1.8%) for $340M.
    • BSM says the assets include ~1.1M gross mineral acres, 380K gross acres of non-participating royalty interests and 600K gross acres of overriding royalty interests collectively spread over 20 states, with major concentrations in Texas, Oklahoma and North Dakota.
    • Assets to be acquired also include positions in the Powder River Basin in Wyoming, the SCOOP play in Oklahoma and the Granite Wash play in Texas.
    • BSM says the deal increases its exposure in the Permian Basin through the addition of 8.3K net royalty acres in the Midland Basin and 7.2K net royalty acres in the Delaware Basin, and raises its exposure to the Bakken/Three Forks play by 10K-plus net royalty acres.

  • TEVA

    Teva shakes up management as it shores up operations; shares up 5%

    • Teva Pharmaceutical Industries' (TEVA +4.8%) new CEO Kåre Schultz takes decisive action aimed at stabilizing the business. The company has realigned its operations and management aimed at increasing internal efficiencies and improving profitability.
    • Commercial operations, historically divided between generic and specialty medicines, will operate as one group across three regions (North America, Europe and Growth Markets). Each will be responsible for their own product portfolios including generics, specialty and over-the-counter.
    • Generic R&D and Specialty R&D will combine into one global group.
    • A newly formed Market & Portfolio function will oversee the coordination between the regions, R&D and operations throughout all stages of the product lifecycle aimed at optimizing the company's product lineup across all therapeutic areas.
    • Management responsibilities:
    • Interim CFO Mike McClellan will serve as EVP and permanent CFO.
    • Dr. Hafrun Fridriksdottir will serve as EVP, Global R&D. Previously, she was SVP and President of Global Generics R&D at Allergan.
    • Brendan O'Grady will serve as EVP, North America Commercial (formerly Chief Commercial Officer, Global Specialty Medicine).
    • Richard Daniell will serve as EVP, European Commercial (formerly President & CEO, Teva Generics Europe).
    • Gianfranco Nazzi, former President & CEO of Growth Markets Generics, will serve as EVP, Growth Markets Commercial.
    • Sven Dethlefs will serve as EVP, Global Marketing & Portfolio (formerly Global Head of Respiratory Medicines).
    • Dr. Michael Hayden, Dr. Rob Koremans and Dipankar Bhattacharjee will retire effective year-end.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 44 Comments

  • BNTC

    Benitec advancing gene therapy candidate BB-301; shares ahead 15% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Benitec Biopharma (NASDAQ:BNTC) is up 15% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that it is on track for an IND filing in Q4 2018 in the U.S. for gene therapy BB-301 for the treatment of oculopharyngeal muscular dystrophy (OPMD). An initial study in humans should commence shortly thereafter.
    • BB-301 is a single-vector (gene therapy construct) system that uses DNA-directed RNA interference to silence the expression of the mutant gene associated with OPMD while adding back a normal copy of the gene to restore function.
    • The company has filed an application with the FDA seeking Orphan Drug status for the indication.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • AAPL

    UBS lowers iPhone sales, FY18 EPS estimates

    • UBS lowers its 2018 Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) iPhone unit sales growth forecast from 12% to 10% following a customer survey.
    • Analyst Steven Milunovich writes that a survey of 6.7K smartphone buyers in five countries showed “flattish” buying intentions from last year, which hints at a “more muted” unit growth than expected.

    • Milunovich also lowers Apple’s FY18 EPS estimate from $11.65 to $11.50.
    • UBS reaffirms its Buy rating and $190 price target on Apple.
    • Apple shares are down 0.13%.

  • PLX

    Protalix Bio's Fabry candidate PRX-102 shows positive effect in Phase 1/2 extension study; shares ahead 6% premarket

    • Protalix BioTherapeutics (NYSEMKT:PLX) is up 6% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 1/2 open-label extension study assessing PRX-102 in patients with Fabry Disease. The data were presented at the New Horizons in Fabry Disease Conference in Dallas, TX.
    • Results at month 24 showed sustained responses across all key Fabry parameters, including a 90% decrease from baseline in Lyso Gb3 levels, stable renal and cardiac function and a 40% improvement in disease severity.
    • 19% (n=3/16) of patients formed antidrug antibodies (two with neutralizing antibodies) in the first 12 months of treatment, but all turned negative over the following 12 months of treatment.
    • PRX-102 is chemically modified version of a recombinant therapeutic enzyme called alpha-galactosidase A. It is currently being evaluated in three Phase 3 studies.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM | 2 Comments

  • BIIB

    Biogen teams up with Alkermes to develop MS candidate ALKS 8700

    • Biogen (NASDAQ:BIIB) and Alkermes plc (NASDAQ:ALKS) enter into a global license and collaboration agreement to develop and commercialize ALKS 8700 for the treatment of relapsing forms of multiple sclerosis (MS).
    • Under the terms of the agreement, Alkermes will receive $28M upfront, milestones up to $200M and mid-teens royalties on global net sales. Biogen secures an exclusive worldwide license to commercialize ALKS 8700 and will be responsible for all development expenses as of January 1, 2018. The $28M payment represents Biogen's share of development expenses incurred this year.
    • Alkermes will be responsible for submitting the marketing application in the U.S. It plans to seek approval under the abbreviated 505(b)(2) pathway referencing Biogen's TECFIDERA (dimethyl fumarate) as the reference drug.
    • Phase 3-stage ALKS 8700 is a monomethyl fumarate prodrug designed to be easier on the GI tract than TECFIDERA.
    • ALKS is up 2% premarket and BIIB is up 1%, both on light volume.
    • Previously: Alkermes confident it can file an NDA in 2018 for ALKS 8700 (Oct. 29, 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharma's Firdapse successful in second late-stage study in LEMS; shares up 3% premarket

    • Catalyst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CPRX) is up 3% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that a second Phase 3 study, LMS-003, assessing Breakthrough Therapy-tagged Firdapse (amifampridine phosphate tablets) for the symptomatic treatment of Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome (LEMS) met its two co-primary endpoints.
    • LEMS is an autoimmune disorder characterized by muscle weakness in the arms and legs caused by the buildup of antibodies at the connection between nerve and muscle (neuromuscular junction). It commonly strikes people over the age of 40 and is prevalent in those with lung cancer.
    • The results will be submitted for presentation at future medical conferences and for publication.
    • The company expects to file a U.S. marketing application next quarter.
    • Management will host a conference call this morning at 8:30 am ET to discuss the results.
    • The company conducted the second study at the request the FDA.
    • Amifampridine enhances neuromuscular transmission by blocking the potassium channel. This causes depolarization of the presynaptic membranes which opens the calcium channel thereby enabling muscle fibers to contract.
    • Previously: Catalyst Pharma down 48% after FDA says new Phase 3 study needed for Firdapse NDA (April 26, 2016)
    • Previously: FDA rejects Catalyst Pharma's Firdapse NDA; shares slump 38% (Feb. 17, 2016)
    • Update: Shares are up 9% premarket on average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 AM
